thread.title: Manchester United's misery Monday continued after FA Cup loss to Chelsea as they were left stranded at airport
thread.title_full: Manchester United's misery Monday continued after FA Cup loss to Chelsea as they were left stranded at airport

author: David McDonnell
title: Manchester United's misery Monday continued after FA Cup loss to Chelsea as they were left stranded at airport
text:
Sport Manchester United's misery Monday continued after FA Cup loss to Chelsea as they were left stranded at airport Boss Jose Mourinho was livid the charter jet that was supposed to ferry his squad home from London was still abroad — meaning they had to make the four-hour trip by bus instead Share Mourinho's men didn't reach Manchester until 4am — and have another huge game on Thursday (Photo: Man Utd/Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jose Mourinho and his Manchester United players were left raging at their club’s shambolic organisation at Heathrow Airport on Monday night. 
A jet chartered by United officials to fly the team and technical staff back to Manchester straight after their controversial FA Cup loss to Chelsea was not available upon their arrival at Heathrow. 
When Mourinho was told that the plane was still overseas and not due to land at Heathrow until 2.30am, a decision was taken to keep his players on the team bus and drive back to Manchester rather than wait another three hours at the airport.
